page.title: 15BLUEBELL STEAM RAILWAY
page.content: The reopening of part of the former Brirish Rail line from Horstead Keynes to East Grinstead is a major talking point.The Bluebell railway runs from Sheffield Park to Horstead Keynes. It is run by a group of steam train enthusiasts as a living steam train museum and the group now wants to join up with the British Rail system by the year 2000. Opposition to the scheme comes from landowners of the former track bed, closed in the mid 60s, which is now used for agriculture & horticulture. Residents of the Imberhorne housing estate are also against the scheme as the former railway cutting through the estate has been filled with household refuse and they fear a major health hazard if the thousands of tons of rotting rubbish are dug up and moved.
